alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 8:36AM EDT until May 02 at 4:19AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine... Sandy River At Mercer affecting Somerset and Franklin Counties. For the Sandy River...including Mercer...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sandy River at Mercer. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding of fields and pastures begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EDT Monday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 12.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
